Package manager

Class WordTracker

java.lang.Object
manager.WordTracker
public class WordTracker extends Object
Version:
1.1 Created: July 28, 2022 Updated: July 28, 2022 Class Description:Specifications Cross-reference program (WordTracker.java), which constructs a binary search tree with all words included from a text file (supplied at the command line) and records the line numbers on which these words were used. The line numbers should be stored with the file names, which in turn are associated with the nodes of the tree. 3. Using Java serialization techniques, store the tree in a binary file (repository.ser). Make sure you insert the class version UID to ensure the backward compatibility with your repository should the class specification change with future enhancements. 4. Every time the program executes, it should check if the binary file (repository.ser) exists, and if so, restores the words tree. The results of the scanning the next file are to be inserted in the appropriate nodes of the tree. Therefore, repository.ser will contain all words occurred in all files scanned with the meta information about those word locations. 5. The user should be able to run the program via the command line as follows: java -jar WordTracker.jar <input.txt> -pf/-pl/-po [-f <output.txt>] a) <input.txt> is the path and filename of the text file to be processed by the WordTracker program. b) 3 mutually exclusive options at command line: - -pf to print in alphabetic order all words along with the corresponding list of files in which the words occur. - -pl to print in alphabetic order all words along with the corresponding list of files and numbers of the lines in which the word occur. - -po to print in alphabetic order all words along with the corresponding list of files, numbers of the lines in which the word occur and the frequency of occurrence of the words. c) Optional argument to redirect of the report in the previous step to the path and filename specified in <output.txt. d) You can assume that the user will provide these arguments in the order shown. *
Author:
Mahdiyeh Abbaspour, Minjong Park

  • Method Details

    • run

      public boolean run(String[] args)
      Runs WordTracker
      Parameters:
      args - the args that contain the check the process of the command line and the methods of creating BSTree, restoring BSTree from Binary file, storing BSTree to Binary File, and creating report for the output text file
      Returns:
      if true, returns the process of the command line and the methods of creating BSTree, restoring BSTree from Binary file, storing BSTree to Binary File, and creating report for the output text file

    • processArgsOfCommandLine

      private boolean processArgsOfCommandLine(String[] args)
      The boolean method to print in alphabetic order all words along with the corresponding list of files at the command line of the three options that are pf, pl, po
      Parameters:
      args - args that include the process for 3 mutually exclusive options which are "-pf", "-pl", "-po" at command line to print in alphabetic order all words
      Returns:
      returns the words corresponding the options to be printed in alphabetic order

    • makeBstFromFile

      private BSTree<Word> makeBstFromFile(BSTree<Word> wordTrackerTree, String inputTextFileNameWithPath) throws FileNotFoundException, TreeException
      The method to create BSTree as word tracker tree, to add line numbers with file name, by reading the text file
      Parameters:
      wordTrackerTree - BSTree that contains word
      inputTextFileNameWithPath - The Path with the name of text file
      Returns:
      returns BSTree as wordTrackerTree that include words
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file already processed file or doesn't exist error occurs
      TreeException - if tree is empty, error occurs

    • doReport

      private void doReport(BSTree<Word> wordTrackerTree, String select, String outputTextFile)
      The method to create report printing output text file java -jar WordTracker.jar <input.txt> -pf/-pl/-po [-f <output.txt>] a) <input.txt> is the path and filename of the text file to be processed by the WordTracker program. b) 3 mutually exclusive options at command line: - -pf to print in alphabetic order all words along with the corresponding list of files in which the words occur. - -pl to print in alphabetic order all words along with the corresponding list of files and numbers of the lines in which the word occur. - -po to print in alphabetic order all words along with the corresponding list of files, numbers of the lines in which the word occur and the frequency of occurrence of the words. c) Optional argument to redirect of the report in the previous step to the path and filename specified in <output.txt.
      Parameters:
      wordTrackerTree - BSTree that contains word
      select - selection corresponding list of files in alphabetic order
      outputTextFile - text file to be output
